tweet: One year after the White House gun violence prevention meeting, Sen Klobuchar led a letter to the President today, urging him to reaffirm his commitment to implement common-sense measures to reduce gun violence. #BackgroundChecks https://www.klobuchar.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/news-releases?ID=B094020A-5F19-4F17-B0C1-B92AD427E577 …

Sen Klobuchar met w/students & discussed how difficult it is to register to vote. #RegisterAmericaToVote Act wld auto register all eligible citizens to vote at age 18. Everyone shld be able to make their voice heard at the ballot box. @amprog @GUVotes @AMarch4OurLives @gencitizen pic.twitter.com/r7dgGSTvOA

In her meeting today with students working to get every eligible citizen registered to vote, Sen Klobuchar singled out the successful work of @AMarch4OurLives, and discussed how much more progress is possible if we pass the Register America to Vote Act #RegisterAmericaToVote pic.twitter.com/Zp83QpGNhY

Voting is how Americans hold their leaders accountable—we should make it easier, not harder, for everyone to get involved. That’s why Sen. Klobuchar introduced the Same Day Registration Act to require states to allow same day voter registration. #RegisterAmericaToVote pic.twitter.com/8Z2ug5LMqX

Young voters turned out in record numbers during the midterms and we need to build on that progress. Today, Sen. Klobuchar met with students who are working to get every eligible citizen registered to vote. #RegisterAmericaToVote pic.twitter.com/V0bCNvbPpI

Sen Klobuchar just introduced the #RegisterAmericaToVote Act to automatically register all eligible citizens to vote when they turn 18. Everyone should be able to make their voice heard at the ballot box. pic.twitter.com/Ud7Uglw7yv

Klobuchar's Social Media Privacy & Consumer Rights Act would give ppl the right to opt-out & keep their info private by disabling data tracking & collection & require terms of service agreements in plain language, In @SenateCommerce she asked @InternetAssn abt support for these. pic.twitter.com/id3hrlCzcM

Sen Klobuchar spoke to the @nabtweets State Leadership Conference yesterday: "I am determined to keep protecting the freedom of the press and that’s because I took an oath to support and defend the constitution." #FreedomOfThePress #WeAreBroadcasters pic.twitter.com/VcCI1MQqNl

Sen Klobuchar took to the Senate floor today to express her opposition to the nomination of Eric Miller to be US Circuit Judge for the Ninth Circuit. Babies can't get vaccinated for Measles until 12-15 months. They rely on others to be vaccinated so they don't get the illness. Measles is so contagious that if one person has it, 90% of the people close to that person not immune will also become infected. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/it-will-take-off-like-a-wildfire-the-unique-dangers-of-the-washington-state-measles-outbreak/2019/02/06/cfd5088a-28fa-11e9-b011-d8500644dc98_story.html?utm_term=.e4b25af28949 …
